page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The Townhead area, and even more the Easterhouse area, have high unemployment (25 - 35% in 1985). In the case of Coatbridge, the decline of its heavy industries of coal and iron-working was not replaced by sufficient numbers of alternative jobs in light industry. But unemployment is particularly a youth problem, and figures show that a generation of young people is growing up without ever having experienced full-time work. A couple of YOP schemes, or a year on the Youth Training Scheme, are for many followed by years on the dole. They then become trapped in a vicious circle, in that they cannot get a job without experience, and they cannot get experience without a job.
